verses.verse: (For the choir director. A Psalm of David.) How <WH575> long, <WH5704> O Lord <WH3068>? Wilt Thou forget <WH7911> me forever <WH5331>? How <WH575> long <WH5704> wilt Thou hide <WH5641> Thy face <WH6440> from me?

How <WH575> long <WH5704> shall I take <WH7896> counsel <WH6098> in my soul, <WH5315> [Having] sorrow <WH3015> in my heart <WH3824> all the day <WH3119>? How <WH575> long <WH5704> will my enemy <WH340> be exalted <WH7311> over <WH5921> me?
Consider <WH5027> [and] answer <WH6030> me, O Lord, <WH3068> my God; <WH430> Enlighten <WH215> my eyes, <WH5869> lest <WH6435> I sleep <WH3462> the [sleep of] death, <WH4194>
Lest <WH6435> my enemy <WH340> say, <WH559> "I have overcome <WH3201> him," [Lest] my adversaries <WH6862> rejoice <WH1523> when <WH3588> I am shaken. <WH4131>
But I have trusted <WH982> in Thy lovingkindness; <WH2617> My heart <WH3820> shall rejoice <WH1523> in Thy salvation. <WH3444>
I will sing <WH7891> to the Lord, <WH3068> Because <WH3588> He has dealt <WH1580> bountifully <WH1580> with me.
